title: NewsBreak: German July Factory Orders Fell 2.7% By Investing.com
text:
NewsBreak: German July Factory Orders Fell 2.7%

Economic Indicators 32 minutes ago (Sep 05, 2019 08:36)

© Reuters. Investing.com -- New orders to Germany's manufacturing sector fell by a seasonally-adjusted 2.7% in July, German statistics office Destatis said Thursday. That puts Europe's largest economy firmly on course for recession in the third quarter. Drop of was bigger than 1.5% fall predicted by analysts, and completely reversed an upwardly revised 2.7% increase in June. Orders were down 5.6% year-on-year in real, seasonally-adjusted terms, compared to a fall of 3.5% in June. Excluding "lumpy" big orders, orders were up 0.5% on the month. Domestic orders fell 0.5% on the month; export orders fell 4.2%; non-euro zone orders fell most of all, by 6.7%. German Bund yield ticked up to -0.66% vs. -0.68% directly before the release.

NewsBreak: German July Factory Orders Fell 2.7%
